question.text: What is the purpose of synergids in an embryosac?

options.text: They divide meiotically to produce antipodal cells.
They contribute towards the formation of polar nuclei.
Synergids function in the guidance of the pollen tube to enter the embryo sac.
Synergids provide nourishment to the cells of embryosac.

solution.text: The ovule is located within the ovary and it consists of nucellus and integuments. They attach to the placentae by means of a stalk called funiculus. There is an opening present in the mature ovule that is called the micropyle. A female gametophyte or embryo sac is present inside the nucellus. The two synergid cells are located in the female gametophyte around the egg and form an egg apparatus. There is a filiform apparatus present on the synergid that guides the entry of the pollen tube to the embryo sac.
